result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:02 AM Defendant Bryan Mitchell Piscina appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Charles Donald Wingrove in court for Bryan Mitchell Piscina.  Prosecuting attorney Jacalyn Christie Labre appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Wingrove State did not have a witness available, This is a speedy trial demand,
Jury trial scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

11:30 AM Defendant Bryan Mitchell Piscina appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Charles Donald Wingrove appeared by phone for Bryan Mitchell Piscina.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Wingrove notes that co-actor in the case is still in absconder status. Does not believe that Deft should be held on this case any longer due to witness missing. Believes Deft would be transferred to Milwaukee House of Corrections if released from this case.
State requests adjournment of this Trial due to another Trial being scheduled this week in another case. In addition notes that Federal authorities were involved and needs some reports to be unredacted for review and may be able to proceed to Trial without the witness.
Defense requests signature bond and Deft to be released from custody due to not being able to meet Speedy Trial Demand.
State unsure if Speedy Trial Demand can be complied with.
Atty Wingrove notes that Speedy Trial expires November 29th.
Court believes that Trial can be accommodated before the end of November.
Court will not amend bond at this time.
Court sets Status Conference for next week.
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:41 PM Defendant Bryan Mitchell Piscina appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Charles Donald Wingrove in court for Bryan Mitchell Piscina.  Prosecuting attorney Joel N Urmanski in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
No identified vicitms.
Court notes Speedy Trial Demand and Trial set for Sept 30th. 
Atty Wingrove does not believe State will be ready to proceed with Trial as scheduled.
DA Urmanski agrees and notes that this arrest was part of a larger investigation with Federal Authorities. Believes there will be additional reports and results and will work diligently to be in touch with Federal Authorities. Notes an offer was presented and rejected and will work with Atty Wingrove regarding a new offer.
Atty Wingrove requests a signature bond and Deft to be released from custody.
State believes this request is premature.
Court agrees. 
Parties agree to 1 day Trial.
Atty Wingrove will speak w/Deft and file bond motion.
Jury trial scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions:
No contact directly or indirectly with the party/parties named in the bail bond, no contact at their residence/property.
Not possess any dangerous weapons
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia.
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional.
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription.
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.
Comply with day reporting requirements - UA's
